Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: A body is falling freely under the action of gravity alone in vacuum. Which one of the following remains constant during the fall?
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: Mechanical energy is the ability of an object to do work. This energy is equal to the sum of kinetic and potential energy, it is always constant.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: Newton's laws of motion do not hold good for objects
options: moving with velocity comparable to velocity of light
Physics (Mechanics).answer: moving with velocity comparable to velocity of light
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: Newton's laws of motion do not hold good for objects moving with velocity comparable to velocity of light because it does not follow it on this level.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: Which one of the following statements is not correct?
options: Weight of a body is different on different planets.
Mass of a body on the earth, on the moon and in empty space is the same.
Weightlessness of a body occurs when the gravitational forces acting on it are counter-balanced.
Weight and mass of a body are equal at sea level on the surface of the earth.
Physics (Mechanics).answer: Weight and mass of a body are equal at sea level on the surface of the earth.
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: Mass is the quantity of matter contained by the object. Weight is the force of gravity acting on a body. Mass is constant anywhere in the universe but weight depends upon the quantity of gravity in a particular place.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: A brick is thrown vertically from an aircraft flying two kilometres above the earth. The brick will fall with a
options: constant speed for some time then with constant acceleration as it nears the earth
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: An object falling from height will show constant velocity so the acceleration will be constant.

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: X-rays are
options: deflected by an electric field but not by a magnetic field
deflected by a magnetic field but not by an electric field
deflected by both a magnetic field and an electric field
not deflected by an electric field or a magnetic field
Physics (Modern Physics).answer: not deflected by an electric field or a magnetic field
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: X-rays are electro magnetic radiations. It has penetrating ability, so it is used in radiography, airport railway security and CT scanning. It is not affected by electric and magnetic fields.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: The focal length of the lens of a normal human eye is about
Physics (Optics).explanation: The focal length of the lens of a normal human eye is about 2.5 cm. The eye sets focus on a thing by adjusting the eye ball. The lens flexes its curvature to focus on the objects.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: The outside rearview mirror of modern automobiles is marked with warning "objects in mirror are closer than they appear". Such mirrors are
options: concave mirrors with very large focal lengths
concave mirrors with very small focal lengths
Physics (Optics).explanation: In convex mirrors, the image is smaller than the object. This mirror provides a wider scope of view so it becomes easy for vehicles use.

Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).question: Red phosphorus is used in the manufacture of safety matches. This is due to the fact that
options: at ordinary temperature, it is less reactive than other varieties of phosphorus
it cannot be converted to white phosphorus on heating
it does not react with halogen on heating
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).answer: at ordinary temperature, it is less reactive than other varieties of phosphorus
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).explanation: Phosphorus is of the two types - White and red. White phosphorus is highly reactive and catches fire at normal room temperature but red phosphorus does not show such nature.

Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry)
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).question: Which one of the following is not true for diamond?
options: Each carbon atom is linked to four other carbon atoms
Three-dimensional network structure of carbon atoms is formed
It is used as an abrasive for sharpening hard tools
It can be used as a lubricant.
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).answer: It can be used as a lubricant.
Chemistry (Inorganic Chemistry).explanation: The structure of diamond. In diamond each carbon (C) atom shares electrons (e-) with four other carbon atoms forming four single bond. shape of structure appears three dimensional network structure. It is very hard structure being used in cutting and sharpening tools. It cannot be used as lubricant.

Chemistry (History & Discoveries).subject: Chemistry (History & Discoveries)
Chemistry (History & Discoveries).question:
Match List-I with List-II and select the correct answer using the code given below the Lists :
List-I (Exponent) List-II (Law)
A. John Dalton 1. Law of definite proportion by volume
B. Joseph Proust 2. Law of multiple proportion
C. Antoine Lavoisier 3. Law of definite proportion by weight
D. Joseph Louis Gay- Lussac 4. Law of conservation of mass
Code:
A B C D A B C D
Chemistry (History & Discoveries).explanation:
Exponent - Law
John Dalton - Law of multiple proportion
Joseph Proust - Law of definite Proportion by weight
Antoine Lavoisier - Law of Conservation of mass
Joseph Louis Gay - Law of definite proportion Lussac by volume.

Chemistry (History & Discoveries).subject: Chemistry (History & Discoveries)
Chemistry (History & Discoveries).question: The atomic theory of matter was first proposed by
Chemistry (History & Discoveries).explanation: John Dalton (1766-1844), an English chemist is known for the work in the development of modern atomic theory. He was awarded the Royal medal for this.

Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry)
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).question: Which of the following is not gaseous air pollutant?
Chemistry (Environmental Chemistry).explanation: Hydrocarbon is related with petro chemicals such as crude oil and petrolium. Environmental pollution by crude oil is generally caused during disposal operations and spilling in water bodies like- oceans, seas and rivers.

Chemistry (Physical Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Physical Chemistry)
Chemistry (Physical Chemistry).question: Which one of the following statement is not correct?
options: Water starts boiling when its vapour pressure becomes equal to atmospheric pressure.
Water is known as universal solvent.
Permanent hardness of water is due to presence of MgCl2, CaCl2, MgSO4 and CaSO4.
Density of ice is greater than that of water.
Chemistry (Physical Chemistry).answer: Density of ice is greater than that of water.
Chemistry (Physical Chemistry).explanation: Ice is less dense in comparison to liquid water. Actually when water freezes, water (H2O) molecules form a crystalline structure by Hydrogen bonds. These bonds cause molecules to push apart lowering the density of water (H2O)

Chemistry (Physical Chemistry).subject: Chemistry (Physical Chemistry)
Chemistry (Physical Chemistry).question: Which one of the following physical quantities is the same for molecules of all gases at a given temperature?
Chemistry (Physical Chemistry).explanation: Kinetic energy is the same for molecules of all gases at a given temperature.

Biology (Genetics).subject: Biology (Genetics)
Biology (Genetics).question: Genetic screening is
options: analysis of DNA to check the presence of a particular gene in a person
analysis of gene in a population
Biology (Genetics).answer: analysis of DNA to check the presence of a particular gene in a person
Biology (Genetics).explanation: Genetic screening is a process through which analysis of gene is performed to find out defective gene causing a specific disorder in a person.

Biology (Genetics).subject: Biology (Genetics)
Biology (Genetics).question: Who among the following is considered as the father of genetic engineering?
Biology (Genetics).explanation: Paul Berg (1926), an American biochemist is considered as the father of genetic engineering. He evolved a technique to join DNAs from two different organisms.

Biology (Genetics).subject: Biology (Genetics)
Biology (Genetics).question:
Which of the following cause(s) variation in the genetic material of progeny?
1. Sexual reproduction
2. Asexual reproduction
3. Mutations
4. Epigenetic changes
Select the correct answer using the code given below.
Biology (Genetics).explanation: Epigenetic Changes, mutations (due to change in DNA structure) and sexual reproduction (due to change during meiosis process) cause variation in the genetic material of off spring.

Biology (Biochemistry).subject: Biology (Biochemistry)
Biology (Biochemistry).question: Cobalt is associated with
Biology (Biochemistry).explanation: Cobalt is an element taking part in the composition of Vitamin B12. It plays an important role in production of blood cells.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question:
Absorption of water in the human body can be found in
1. renal tubule in kidney
2. hepatic cells in liver
3. large intestine
4. pancreatic duct
Select the correct answer using the code given below.
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation:
Large intestine is the last part of alimentary canal where extra water is absorbed to prepare the waste as a solid stool.
The Renal tubule in kidney is responsible for absorption of water to produce proper concentration of urine.

Biology (Human Physiology).subject: Biology (Human Physiology)
Biology (Human Physiology).question: Neutrophils and lymphocytes originate from
Biology (Human Physiology).explanation: Bone marrow is located within the bone cavities. It is composed of stromal cells and parenchymal cells. Neutrophils and lymphocytes are blood cells which are produced within bone marrow.

Biology (Diseases).subject: Biology (Diseases)
Biology (Diseases).question: Measles is a disease caused by
Biology (Diseases).explanation: Measles is a viral disease which is also called rubeola. It is a contagious disease spreading through contact sneezing and coughing etc.

Biology (Diseases).subject: Biology (Diseases)
Biology (Diseases).question: The mandate of the scheme entitled 'Directly Observed Treatment, Short-Course (DOTS)' launched by WHO is to ensure that
options: doctors treat patients with medicine for a short duration
doctors do not start treatment without a trial
patients complete their course of drug
Biology (Diseases).answer: patients complete their course of drug
Biology (Diseases).explanation: DOTS (Directly Observed Treatment, Short course) launched by WHO is a therapy for treatment of TB patient.

Biology (Diseases).subject: Biology (Diseases)
Biology (Diseases).question: Penicillin inhibits synthesis of bacterial
Biology (Diseases).explanation: Penicillin is very effective medicine against bacterial infection. During bacterium division, it prevents the cell wall formation. Thus it helps in prevention of bacterial growth.

Biology (Diseases).subject: Biology (Diseases)
Biology (Diseases).question:
Most antibiotics target bacterial parasites interfering with various factors of growth of metabolism such as
1. synthesis of cell wall
2. bacterial protein Synthesis
3. synthesis of nuclear membrane
4. mitochondrial function
Select the correct answer using the code given below
Biology (Diseases).explanation: Mostly antibiotics inhibit the synthesis of cell wall and protein synthesis in bacteria. Due to this reason, bacterial infection is controlled by this type of medicines.
